components.description: A yellow face with simple, open eyes and a flat, closed mouth. Intended to depict a neutral sentiment but often used to convey mild irritation and concern or a deadpan sense of humor.
components.title: Neutral Face

description: A yellow face with simple, open eyes and a flat, closed mouth. Intended to depict a neutral sentiment but often used to convey mild irritation and concern or a deadpan sense of humor.
title: Neutral Face

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.definition: A face featuring a straight-and-closed mouth, not giving away any particular emotion. Neutral Face was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 20 http://emojipedia.org/neutral-face/
emoji_net_data.name: neutral face

bn:00100974a: Deliberately impassive or expressionless (as a face or look).

bn:00101571a: Afflicted with or marked by anxious uneasiness or trouble or grief.
Afflicted with or marked by anxious uneasiness or trouble or grief

bn:13640357v: To express (oneself) in an impassive or expressionless manner.

bn:00032600n: Part of the body at the front of the head
The face is a central organ of sense and is also very central in the expression of emotion among humans and among numerous other species.
Faces are the central sense organ complexes, for those animals that have one, normally on the ventral surface of the head.
The front of the human head from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear
The front part of the head, featuring the eyes, nose, and mouth and the surrounding area.

bn:03386156n: Humor that is presented with no change of expression; deadpan
Deadpan is a form of comic delivery in which humor is presented without a change in emotion or body language.

bn:00068782n: Sadness is emotional pain associated with, or characterized by feelings of disadvantage, loss, despair, helplessness, sorrow, and rage.
Emotions experienced when not in a state of well-being
Sadness is emotional pain associated with, or characterized by feelings of disadvantage, loss, despair, helplessness and sorrow.

bn:00004840n: Apathy is most commonly defined as a lack of feeling, emotion, interest, or concern.
A lack of interest; indifference, apathy.
State of indifference or the suppression of emotions
Apathy is a lack of feeling, emotion, interest, or concern.
Complete lack of emotion or motivation about a person, activity, or object; depression; lack of interest or enthusiasm; disinterest.
The trait of lacking enthusiasm for or interest in things generally.
The trait of lacking enthusiasm for or interest in things generally

bn:00006386n: An expression or appearance indicating a certain state of mind.
The feelings expressed on a person's face
The expression or countenance that seems to an onlooker to be represented by the appearance of a person's face, resulting from specific use of that person's facial muscles.
A facial expression is one or more motions or positions of the muscles beneath the skin of the face.
A movement of the face that conveys emotional state
A facial appearance usually associated with an emotion.
Facial expression is the combination of motions or positions of the muscles in the skin that conveys the emotional state of the individual to observers. expression
